column5: My fishing buddy and constant companion passed away suddenly and peacefully at home last Thursday. Fraser was a quirky gentle giant, misunderstood by some, loved by all. He will be greatly missed by all those that took the time to know him.  April 1, 1996 - June 12, 2008 (came into our lives February 7, 2004)  We will cherish his memory always.    "If love could have saved you, you would have lived forever"
Very very sorry to hear that news Barnie, it's tough to lose a good pal like that.
Sorry to hear this news...that's a great pic of him there....he looked like he was certainly in his element there.  Condolences to you and all who knew him....  Cliff and Bly
So sad.   I know how tough it is to lose a friend like that.
Sad day Bernie ... just went through that myself earlier this year.  It's tough and I still think of her often.  Often enough, she is now my computer desktop and my avitar.   I can feel for you bud.
Very sorry for your loss Barnie......its just as hard as losing a family member.  Sinker
My condolences.... it is losing a family member.
....and my condolences as well.
Sorry for your loss dude.. thats a good long time for a doggie do though.. im sure you'll miss 'em
Sorry for your loss, i know your not alone.
I can tell by Frasers picture that he was a #1 friend and companion. Eager to please ; hurry up and throw the stick will you.  Sorry for your loss Barnie.

Been there and been through it.  You were blessed to have him in your life.  Its been over 10 years since I lost my buddy and I still think of him often.  Got a Father's day card today with a Yellow Lab on the front. Brings back many fond memories. Really sorry to hear of your loss bud.  He looked like a great partner.

It is a wonderful bond that forms between us and our beloved pets, all they ever want is a little food and water and a bit of affection and they give us their hearts, always eager to please, always happy to be with us. Is it any wonder why we miss them so much when they are gone, we have just lost a part of our lives. Keep the memory alive!
Sorry for your loss, it's never easy, but he was a handsome fella.  Maureen
Just the look on his face tells it all...I'm very sorry to hear about your best buddy..I went through the same thing a few years back...
Sorry for your loss!!!!!
Very sorry for your loss Barnie. They have a very special place in our hearts.
Horrible to lose a good buddy. So sorry for your loss. Great pic of him!  Sincerely, 1leg
You know good things come & go throughout our lifetime. The love will always remain in our minds.
Sorry for your loss Barney, Fraser was a beautiful looking dog.  Been through this and it is a very hard time to lose your companion and fishing buddy, hang in there.
That is very sad news Barnie.  Very sorry for your loss.  It sounds like Fraser was a very much loved dog.  Joey

Thanks to everyone for your kind words. Fraser came to us as a reclamation project. He arrived leaderless, lacking structure and frustrated with that and his lack of belonging. All these things were changed and he blossomed. Everything we gave to him he gave back to us a million times over.  We have started a memory book and it is filling fast. Fraser touched our lives in the most special way.  The support of the OFC Community is appreciated.
